text:
Hello all, I'm finally finding time to transition from using the Drag and Drop visual editor to HTML + Hubl templates! Does anybody have any good articles on the benefits (besides the official docs :grimacing:) and how the experience can change/be improved for the end user?

I have one particular client who likes to be able to dip into the Design Manager to do bits and pieces themselves sometimes and I'm concerned that I'll be taking this power away from them!
Hi Chris, regarding your concern for that specific client. Do they tend to make actual code changes, or simply change say field values in modules, and re-arrange things?
does HubSpot have any monitoring for when a URL or HubSpots goes down?

For HubSpot and specific HubSpot tools yes there is around the clock non-stop monitoring <https://status.HubSpot.com/>

As far as an uptime monitor for a specific URL, no. Lots of tools exist for that, I’ve heard of people using pingdom for it.

Generally though if you or your client have questions about HubSpot’s reliability, this page can likely answer most of them:
<https://www.HubSpot.com/reliability>
thank you <@U7SL518D6>, so do you know the different API responses from this JSON response that HS has: <https://status.HubSpot.com/api/v2/status.json>
:heart: :heart: :heart:  I’ll try to be in here more frequently

<@UFB9AJJMA> I think that you can strike a balance by using custom modules. I just throw code in there then let clients drag them around in a flex column. Unless the client can’t be trusted with string it saves you from having to make a new file every time they want to lose one module for a specific page. Hi Jon!
Hi, anyone know how I can restore a post deleted? I have only the link of post
